t: Wickedness of Men and Lovingkindness of God.
For the choir director. A Psalm of David the servant of the Lord.
Transgression*pn speaks to the ungodly within his heart; There*ln is no fear of God before his eyes.
For*ln it flatters him in his own*i eyes Concerning*ln the discovery of his iniquity and*i the hatred of*i it.*i
The*ln words of his mouth are wickedness and deceit; He*ln has ceased to be wise and*i to do good.
He*ln plans wickedness upon his bed; He*ln sets himself on a path that is not good; He*ln does not despise evil.
Your*ln lovingkindness, O Lord,*s extends to the heavens, Your*ln faithfulness reaches*i to the skies.
Your*ln righteousness is like the mountains of God; Your*ln judgments are like*i a great deep. O*ln Lord,*s You preserve man and beast.
How*ln precious is Your lovingkindness, O God! And*ln the children of men take refuge in the shadow of Your wings.
They*ln drink their fill of the abundance of Your house; And*ln You give them to drink of the river of Your delights.
For*ln with You is the fountain of life; In*ln Your light we see light.
O*ln continue Your lovingkindness to those who know You, And*ln Your righteousness to the upright in heart.
Let*ln not the foot of pride come upon me, And*ln let not the hand of the wicked drive me away.
There*ln the doers of iniquity have fallen; They*ln have been thrust down and cannot rise.
